question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable whenever possible. Create a web-based sound effects library where users can browse various preset sound effects (such as transition effects, ambient sounds), preview them, and download or apply selected effects to their own audio projects.

checklist.title: Is the sound library core system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements the sound library architecture, including categorization of sound effects, audio playback engine, and preview functionality. Score 0 if the core audio playback is not implemented, 5 if only basic playback is implemented without proper controls, and 10 if the system includes comprehensive playback with volume control, seeking, and visualization.

checklist.title: Is the sound effects browsing system efficiently designed?
checklist.description: Check if the interface implements intuitive browsing capabilities with proper categorization (e.g., transitions, ambient, UI sounds), tagging system, search functionality, and filtering options. Deduct 3 points if search functionality is missing, 4 points if there's no categorization system, and 3 points if filtering options are absent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the preview system well-implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether users can preview sound effects before downloading, including visual waveform representation, playback controls (play/pause/stop), and the ability to loop sounds. Check if preview quality matches download quality. Deduct 5 points if waveform visualization is missing, 3 points if loop functionality is absent, and 2 points if preview quality is significantly lower. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are download and project application features properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code provides functionality to download individual or multiple sound effects in common formats (WAV, MP3) and the ability to apply selected effects to audio projects (e.g., timeline integration, batch processing). Deduct 3 points for each missing download format, 5 points if there's no batch download option, and 4 points if project application functionality is incomplete. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as unsupported audio formats, browser audio limitations, simultaneous playback issues, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Real-time audio effects/filters 2. Customizable sound mixer for layering effects 3. Audio fingerprinting for similar sound recommendation). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple audio players with overlapping capabilities) 2. Function modules unrelated to sound effects library (e.g., extensive video editing features) 3. Fancy effects that affect audio performance (e.g., excessive animations during playback). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating audio processing/UI/data management layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size â‰¥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Audio playback starts within 100ms of click 2) Transition animations between library sections controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual feedback during sound playback. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for laggy audio playback response, and 5 points for unintuitive audio control interfaces. The full score is 10 points.
